content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-226-06-A |Item_parent=Deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism (see item 330) |Item_parent_short=Deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism (see item 330) |Rank=A |Title=Know the indications for D-dimer measurement (DVT, PE) and the concept of an age-adjustment threshold in PE. |Description=None |Topic=Positive diagnosis |Contributors=Gilles Pernod, Virginie Dufrost, Guillaume Mahé |Order=6}} D-dimer: - fibrin degradation products. - non-specific - but high negative predictive value # If they are below the diagnostic threshold, they enable the diagnosis of DVT or PE to be ruled out if the clinical probability is not high. # The threshold is adjusted for age for the diagnosis of exclusion of non-severe PE: < 500 µg/L if the patient is under 50 years of age, < [age × 10] µg/L if the patient is over 50 years of age. Age adjustment does not apply to DVT diagnosis. - Does not apply to severe or high-probability PE.

question.title: What is the correct interpretation of the D-dimer threshold for ruling out deep vein thrombosis (DVT) or pulmonary embolism (PE)?

option_a.title: A D-dimer level below 500 µg/L is always used to rule out DVT or PE in all patients, regardless of age.
option_a.description: This option is correct but does not take into account age adjustment for PE diagnosis

option_b.title: A D-dimer level below 500 µg/L is used to rule out DVT or PE in patients under 50 years of age, and below [age × 10] µg/L in patients over 50 years of age.
option_b.description: This option correctly states the age-adjusted threshold for PE diagnosis

option_c.title: A D-dimer level below 500 µg/L is used to rule out DVT or PE in all patients, regardless of age, and is also used for the diagnosis of DVT.
option_c.description: This option incorrectly applies the D-dimer threshold to both DVT and PE diagnosis

option_d.title: A D-dimer level below 500 µg/L is used to rule out DVT or PE only in patients over 50 years of age, and below [age × 10] µg/L in patients under 50 years of age.
option_d.description: This option incorrectly reverses the age-adjusted threshold for PE diagnosis
